author: Luis Gomez
title: Around Town: Jake Arrieta responds to Pirates fans on Twitter
text:
Jake Arrieta has a message for Pittsburgh Pirates fans planning to attend Wednesday’s wild card game between the Cubs and Pirates: Bring it on.
Arrieta will take the mound for the Cubs during the do-or-die game at PNC Park in Pittsburgh and, naturally, has been hearing it from Pirates fans recently on Twitter.
“Be ready for the sea of black #BlackOut #BUCN #crowdIsGoingToEatYoualive #walkTheplank,” wrote one fan, whose Twitter photo features Arrieta’s face on Jake from the State Farm commercials.
Rather than ignore the tweet, Arrieta, who is one of the Cubs’ most interesting personalities on Twitter when he wants to be, let the fan know how much of a factor the crowd will play in the game.
“Whatever helps keep your hope alive, just know, it doesn't matter. @Cubs,” Arrieta tweeted .
NPR host David Greene tweeted that he was going to start using a pro-Pirates #WeMatter hashtag after that and tried to get late night talk show host and fellow Pirates fan Seth Meyers to do the same, to which Arrieta responded “David. Bring out all the reinforcements. I need it LOUD.”
Arrieta addressed the first tweet Monday during his hourlong interview with ESPN 1000’s “Carmen and Jurko Show” at Chicago Cut Steakhouse.
“There are so many things on Twitter, so many mentions, it’s hard to get through all of them,” Arrieta said. “The one that I responded just happened to be the first or second one I saw. I didn’t know who it was. I just felt like it was time to throw a little something out there and let the people on Twitter go nuts.
"What I was referring to was the crowd. It’s not going to affect the way I pitch. I’m going to go out there and prepare and execute like I have been. I’m not saying I won’t make a mistake throughout the game. It’s up to them to capitalize on those mistakes.”
Swallow your pride: Downtown and North Side Giordano’s locations will sell large stuffed pizzas decorated with the Cubs' trademark “W” flag logo the day of Cubs playoff games beginning Wednesday. The “W” on the “Fly the W” pizza is made of fresh parmesan cheese. The Giordano’s in Prudential Plaza sold a pizza with a parmesan cheese Cubs logo during the Cubs Convention in January. Giordano’s – if you didn’t already know – is a Cubs sponsor.
"Fly the W" Pizza Photo courtesy of Giordano's Famous Stuffed Pizza The Cubs-inspired "Fly the W" Pizza from Giordano's.
The Cubs-inspired "Fly the W" Pizza from Giordano's.
(Photo courtesy of Giordano's Famous Stuffed Pizza) By the numbers: 1. Kris Bryant's ranking in jersey sales among all baseball players this season. The Cubs' star is the first rookie to have the best selling jersey since Major League Baseball started releasing the jersey sales list in 2010.
Great Scott!: Ryne Sandberg is scheduled to host Wednesday’s pep rally for the Cubs at Harry Caray’s Italian Steakhouse-Chicago, which takes place from 5 to 10 a.m. Because 1989’s “Back to the Future II” predicted the Cubs would win the 2015 World Series, Harry Caray’s will have the actual Sports Almanac and hoverboard from the time traveling sequel on display, courtesy of “Back to the Future” special effects director Michael Lantieri. Sandberg is expected to watch the wild card game at Harry Caray’s that night.
On the record: “We got the nice cool weather for you. You ought to be able to run all day. But don’t run all day.” -- Mike Ditka’s pep talk for runners prior to Saturday’s Ditka Dash 5K run outside Soldier Field.
“I think #Cinderella was impressed with my height!” – The Bulls’ Pau Gasol’s on meeting the star of Lyric Opera of Chicago’s “Cinderella,” via Instagram .
Heads up: The Squared Circle co-owner Lisa Marie Varon (known as Victoria during her WWE days) and WWE Hall of Famer Bob Backlund are scheduled to appear at the pizza and gourmet burgers restaurant after Monday’s “Raw” at Allstate Arena.
